context.title: Edit Data Set - Data Set
context.description: Edit or view the following attributes of the data set: - Data Source - Change the data source for the data set. - Output Columns - Add an alias or display name for each column that BIRT uses in Data Explorer and in column headings of a table. Specify a display name ID that specifies the resource key. - Computed Columns - Add the result of an expression to the data set. - Parameters - Create a data set parameter to filter the result set in a query. At runtime, the data set parameter provides a replacement for the ? parameter marker in the WHERE clause of the query. - Filters - Filter the data set as an alternative to filtering the data source. - Property Binding - Bind the data set parameter to the report parameter. Specify a time limit for the query request. Typically, the report parameter prompts the user for a value and passes it to the data set parameter to use in the query. - Settings - Include all rows in the preview of query results, or limit the number of rows. BIRT ignores this setting when the data set editor preferences specifies fewer rows. - Preview Results - View column names and field values that the query retrieves from the data source.

topic.label: How to view and change output columns
How to add a computed field to a data set
How to define a data set parameter

context.title: Edit Data Source - JDBC Data Source - Property Binding
context.description:
Use this page to define the run-time attributes of a JDBC data source. Values that you set on this page override the values defined on the other pages of Edit Data Source. You can use JavaScript to build the property binding value, for example, to access the values of report parameters.
- JDBC Driver Class: Type an expression for the JDBC driver. This driver specifies the brand of database you use. - JDBC Driver URL: Type an expression for the URL for the machine that runs the database. - User Name: Type an expression for the user name you use to access the database. - Password: Type an expression for the Password for the user name. - JNDI URL: Type an expression for the URL for the JNDI name you use to access the database. - Connection Profile Name: Type an expression for the name of the connection profile. - Connection Profile Store URL: Type an expression for the URL to the location of the connection profile store.

context.title: Edit Data Source - Flat File Data Source - Property Binding
context.description:
Use this page to define the run-time attributes of a flat file data source. Values that you set on this page override the values defined on the other pages of Edit Data Source. You can use JavaScript to build the property binding value, for example, to access the values of report parameters.
- Home Folder: Type an expression for the path to a folder that contains the flat file to use as a data source. - CSV Type: Type an expression for the data format. Valid values are: - CSV for comma-separated values - PSV for pipe-separated values - SSV for space-separated values - TSV for tab-separated values - Character Set: Type an expression for the character set that the data values use. - Use First Line as Column Name Indicator: Type an expression for a Boolean value. True indicates that the file provides data field names in its first line. False indicates that the first line does not contain data field names. - Use Second Line as Data Type Indicator: If the value of Use First Line as Column Name Indicator is false, this field applies to the first line of the flat file, rather than the second line. Type an expression for a Boolean value. True indicates that the file provides data types for the data fields. False indicates that the line does not contain data field types. - Connection Profile Name: Type an expression for the name of the connection profile. - Connection Profile Store URL: Type an expression for the URL to the location of the connection profile store.

context.title: Edit Data Source - Web Service Data Source - Property Binding
context.description:
Use this page to define the run-time attributes of a web service data source. Values that you set on this page override the values defined on the other pages of Edit Data Source. You can use JavaScript to build the property binding value, for example, to access the values of report parameters.
- SOAP End Point: Leave this field empty if the descriptor defines the end point or if the WSDL does not require a SOAP end point. If your WSDL does require a SOAP end point, type an expression for the URL here. - Connection Class: If you have written a Java class to perform the connection to and of the WSDL data source, type an expression for the fully qualified path to this class. This class must implement the org.eclipse.datatools.enablement.oda.ws.api.IWSDriver interface. - Connection Time Out: Type an expression for the length of time, in seconds, to wait for the connection to succeed. - WSDL URL: Type an expression for the URL for Web Services data that is a network resource. - Driver ClassPath: If you have a custom driver class, type an expression to list the JAR files or folders to search for the class in Driver Class Path. Separate multiple folders and JAR files with semicolon (;) characters in the normal way. - Connection Profile Name: Type an expression for the name of the connection profile. - Connection Profile Store URL: Type an expression for the URL to the location of the connection profile store.

context.title: Edit Data Source - XML Data Source - Property Binding
context.description:
Use this page to define the run-time attributes of a XML data source. Values that you set on this page override the values defined on the other pages of Edit Data Source. You can use JavaScript to build the property binding value, for example, to access the values of report parameters.
- XML Data Source File: Type an expression for the full name of the XML file to use as the data source. - XML Data Source Encoding: Type an expression for the character encoding that the XML data uses. - XML Data Source Schema File: Type an expression for the full name of the schema to use for the XML file. - Connection Profile Name: Type an expression for the name of the connection profile. - Connection Profile Store URL: Type an expression for the URL to the location of the connection profile store.

context.title: Edit Data Set - JDBC Data Set - Property Binding
context.description:
Use this page to define the run-time attributes of a JDBC data set. Values that you set on this page override the values defined on the other pages of Edit Data Set. You can use JavaScript to build the property binding value, for example, to access the values of report parameters.
- Query Text: Type an expression for the SQL statement for the query. - Query Time Out: Type an expression for the length of time, in seconds, to wait for the query to return the first data row.

context.title: Edit Data Set - Flat File Data Set - Property Binding
context.description:
Use this page to define the run-time attributes of a flat file data set. Values that you set on this page override the values defined on the other pages of Edit Data Set. You can use JavaScript to build the property binding value, for example, to access the values of report parameters.
In Query Text, type an expression for the query. Use the XML source tab in the Report Design Perspective to locate the QueryText element of an existing flat file data set. Use this element as a template for the required syntax.

context.title: Edit Data Set - Web Service Data Set - Property Binding
context.description:
Use this page to define the run-time attributes of a web service data set. Values that you set on this page override the values defined on the other pages of Edit Data Set. You can use JavaScript to build the property binding value, for example, to access the values of report parameters.
- Query Text: Type an expression for the SOAP request template for the query. Use the XML source tab in the Report Design Perspective to locate the QueryText element of an existing web service data set. Use this element as a template for the required syntax. - XML File: Type an expression for the name of the XML file that contains sample data for the SOAP response. - Schema File: Type an expression for the name of the XML schema file for the SOAP response on the file system.

context.title: Preferences - Library page
context.description:
Use this page to add or remove libraries.
A BIRT report library is a collection of report components that can be used in a report design. Report components include reusable visual report items, data sources, data sets, parameters, translations and more.
A library is a customizable, pre-defined set of rules that helps a user quickly create a report with a specific look.
A BIRT library includes both formatting information and rules that help you create a report. A library is like a skin for a report; it takes the data, structure, and layout of a report, and applies formatting defined in the library to transform the appearance of the report.
A library can start with a style sheet, a set of common styles to apply to all reports within an application. The library can then add commonly used data sources, reusable components, translated text, images and more.

Set the appearance of a selected item in the report layout editor.
To display a selected item with an animated highlight, select Enable animated selection.
To display a selected item with a gradient highlight that is not animated, deselect Enable animated selection, then select Enable gradient selection.
To display a selected item with a simple outline with handles, deselect both Enable animated selection and Enable gradient selection.

Specify the maximum amount of data that a report displays in the Preview page of the report editor. Reducing any of these values makes the report preview faster. Increasing these values produces a report preview that contains more of the data in your data set.
To display all the rows returned by the data set, select No limits on the number of rows to display. To set the maximum number of rows, type a value in Number of rows to display.
To set the maximum number of rows to display in a group in a table or cross tab, type a value in Member count of each row level to display.
To set the maximum number of columns to display in a horizontal group in a cross tab, type a value in Member count of each column level to display.

To create a filter, select a column or build an expression that specifies the data to filter. Select a conditional operator and values for the operation. Use this type of filter when the data source does not support filtering in the query.
